page.title: 02KITCLIFF FARM
page.content: {Kitcliff farm}is a mixed dairy farm in the{Piethorne valley,} a part of the{Pennine chain.}If you go to Kitcliff farm in the spring you will see lots of signs that say{"DO NOT {HANDLE THE LAMBS".}This is because the lambs would pick up your scent, follow you around and their mother would abondon them.As the farm is a mixed dairy farm they have{sheep, {goats,poultry,five bulls and freisian {cows}.As we were walking up the hills we noticed that the{foothills}were very green, but at the{upland farm}the grass was a more yellow colour.This is because the foothill farmer puts {organic fertiliser}on the fields to keep them healthy. The farmer is not allowed to put{inorganic}fertiliser on the fields without permission from the {water board. L/G/29/5/85
